title: Docs say --remap-path-prefix treats paths as strings during matching but compiler does not

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Our `--remap-path-prefix` documentation says ["The
replacement is purely textual, with no consideration of the current system's
pathname syntax."](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/e013f9e0ca4055930f931a30171c355de42f9f92/src/doc/rustc/src/command-line-arguments.md?plain=1#L372-L376). But that currently is not the case. Prefix matching is implemented via [Path::strip_prefix](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/path/struct.Path.html#method.strip_prefix) which can behave [quite differently](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=2c02b36983155b9075419a344dfa65ab):

```
`abc` is a prefix of `abc/def`
`abc/.` is a prefix of `abc/def`
`ab` is NOT a prefix of `abc/def`
`abc` is NOT a prefix of `./abc/def`
`./abc` is NOT a prefix of `abc/def`
`./abc` is a prefix of `./abc/def`
```

It's unclear whether we should update the documentation or change the compiler's behavior. 

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```

commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c

```
